revised_title: Edward Fawcett: A Life Dedicated to Anatomy and Archaeology
tldr: Edward Fawcett was a renowned anatomist who held the chair of human anatomy at the University of Bristol for 41 years. He made significant contributions to the understanding of human anatomy through his research on variations in the human body and the development of the mammalian skull. Fawcett also played a crucial role in the establishment and success of the Speleological Society of Bristol University, which explored limestone caves and discovered fossil remains, artifacts, and evidence of early Celtic settlements. In his later years, he focused on studying and photographing architectural features, church furniture, and heraldry in churches across Gloucester, Somerset, and Wiltshire.
